document.docAuthor: González-Obando, Ranulfo, Carrejo-Gironza, Nancy & García, Alfonso N.
document.docTitle: Triplocania yanacona González-Obando & Carrejo-Gironza & García 2017, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of Colombian Triplocania Roesler (Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Ptiloneuridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Colombian Triplocania Roesler (Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’: Ptiloneuridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Central sclerite of hypandrium convex anteriorly, with postero-lateral, mid sized processes, and median, stout posterior process, bilobed distally; phallosome V-shaped anteriorly, with side struts slender, independent proximally; external parameres distally rounded, sclerotized, with a field of short spines; anterior pair of endophallic sclerites with stout inner arms, wider anteriorly, a central stem flanked by processes; outer arms arising from the central stem, pedicellate, each arm distally dilated to form a broadly elliptic, rugose body; mesal sclerite W-shaped, with anterior arms long, slender, and posterior arms stout, obtusely concave distally; posterior sclerites transverse, slender, each bearing an acuminate process medially on posterior border ( Fig. 292 ). Belonging in the species assemblage mentioned above, in the diagnosis of
T. pericosensis
n. sp.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 281–286.
Triplocania sevillaensis
n. sp.
Female. 281. Forewing. 282. Hindwing. 283. Front view of head. 284. Paraprocts and epiproct. 285. Subgenital plate. 286. Ninth sternum and left gonapophyses. Scales in mm.

FIGURES 287–292.
Triplocania yanacona
n. sp.
Male. 287. Forewing. 288. Hindwing. 289. Front view of head. 290. Paraprocts and epiproct. 291. Hypandrium. 292. Phallosome. Scales in mm.

FIGURES 293–298.
Triplocania yanacona
n. sp.
Female. 293. Forewing. 294. Hindwing. 295. Front view of head. 296. Paraprocts and epiproct. 297. Subgenital plate. 298. Ninth sternum and left gonapophyses. Scales in mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Color (in 80% ethanol). Body, head, legs, epiproct, paraprocts and wings as in the males; subgenital plate with middle area hyaline, pigmented area V-shaped, sides dark, gonapophyses brown; IX sternum pale brown, with orange central area. Epiproct and paraprocts pale brown.

Etymology. This species is dedicated to the Yanacona ethnic group, widely distributed in southwestern Colombia , particularly in the departments of Cauca and Valle del Cauca .
